FAQ

Twitter
Facebook
Linkedin
email
What is Steel ?

Steel is an alloy of iron and carbon (with a content between 0.005% and 2% in weight) to which we add a number of elements such as Chromium, Molybdenum, Nickel, Titanium… in varying proportions to make them low and high alloys.

What are special steels ?
Special steels are so called when their chemical composition makes them different from  more standard steels, with little or no alloy content, either because they contain more alloying elements, or because all the characteristics (purity and cleanliness) are controlled to give them the properties required for use.
What are the speciality grades of Ascometal® ?
Jomasco®, Metasco®, Splitasco®, Vitac®, Supervitac®, Ascoflex®, Ascowell®, Ascoroc®, Enduasco®, Nitrasco®.
What is the range of products delivered by Ascometal® ?
  • Through & Surface Hardening steels
  • Case-hardening steels
  • Bearing steels
  • Spring steels
  • Induction hardening steels
  • Steels for fasteners
  • Nitriding steels
  • Micro alloyed steel
  • Tool steels
  • Sulfurized, resulfurized
  • lead content
What is the range of products produced by Ascometal® ?
CC rounds : 170 to 325 mm
Ingots
Hot rolled products :
  • Rolled Blooms and billets : 80 to 400 mm
  • Bars : 11 to 325 mm
  • Wire rod : 5 to 32 mm

Cold finished products :

  • Peeled bars : 10 to 300 mm
  • ground bars : 10 to 100 mm
  • Cold drawn wire rod : 1 to 22 mm
Semi-finished parts
What kind of heat treatment is available ?
  • Quenching (Oil /polymer/water) and tempering
  • Water / water and polymer quenching and tempering
  • Oil quenching and tempering
  • Single or double quenching
  • Stabilising
  • Annealing treatment
  • Annealing, stress relieving, spheroidal annealing, isothermal, normalising, isothermal pearlitic
